intro: Vincetoxicum flavidulum, commonly known as yellow woodbine, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy underside. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Vincetoxicum flavidulum is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
